thread.title: Joe Haden still in concussion protocol, Duke Johnson's shoulder OK, Gary Barnidge on injury report with ankle
thread.title_full: Joe Haden still in concussion protocol, Duke Johnson's shoulder OK, Gary Barnidge on injury report with ankle | cleveland.com

author: Mary Kay Cabot, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Joe Haden still in concussion protocol, Duke Johnson's shoulder OK, Gary Barnidge on injury report with ankle
text:
BEREA, Ohio -- Browns cornerback Joe Haden remains in the concussion protocol and Browns safety Tashaun Gipson was among four injured players who sat out practice Wednesday on the first day of preparation for Sunday's game against the Rams.
Haden sat out Sunday's 26-23 overtime loss to the Broncos with his concussion, and Gipson sat out for the second straight week with his mid-ankle sprain.
Two other injured players who rested Wednesday were Craig Robertson (ankle) and tight end Rob Housler (hamstring). Linebacker Tank Carder wore a red caution jersey.
The Browns also had a few additions to the injury report this week coming off the Broncos game: tight end Gary Barnidge (ankle), nosetackle Danny Shelton (ankle), linebacker Nate Orchard (groin) and defensive tackle John Hughes (knee). They will likely be listed as limited.
On the other hand, running back Duke Johnson, who was checked for a concussion during the Broncos game and suffered a shoulder injury, is not on the injury report and will face the Rams. Also, quarterback Josh McCown, who was limited with an ankle injury all last week, is no longer listed.
Pettine said more help is on the way too. Rookie cornerback Charles Gaines (hamstring), who's been on short-term injured reserve with a pulled hamstring, began practicing Wednesday and can be activated after Week 8.
Running back Glenn Winston, who's on the reserve/non-football injury list with a knee injury, also returned to practice Wednesday.
"We'll work them in slowly,'' said Pettine.
In other quick-hitters from Pettine:
• He said the top four receivers "are entrenched'' and indicated it will be tough for Dwayne Bowe to get on the field anytime soon. He said after the top four, the ability to play special teams is imperative.
• He said the 32nd-ranked run defense is "a source of frustration and probably the biggest issue we deal with here.''
• He said he's very eager to see what Gaines can do, especially after a promising performance in training camp.
• He said rookie tight end E.J. Bibbs "is in the conversation'' to be active this week with Housler struggling with the hamstring.
